title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The issue is that there is a line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil that uses Class.forName() to create a Callback object. This is causing a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: The expected behavior is to remove the reflection usage in BidiUtil and find an alternative way to create the Callback object without relying on Class.forName().
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink (or similar tools).
3. Observe that a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown when BidiUtil is accessed.
